avalancheActivity.comment: In isolated cases avalanches can be triggered in persistent weak layers on very steep shady slopes in high alpine regions. These releases are mostly small-sized. The risks of falling and sustaining injuries outweigh those of being buried in snow masses. At very high altitudes in ridgeline terrain, gullies and bowls, freshly generated but usually small-sized snowdrift accumulations require attentiveness.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated avalanche prone locations occur in persistent weak layer of old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack surface is generally melt-freeze encrusted, in some places it is iced over. It then softens up slightly on sunny slopes during the daytime hours. On shady slopes there are usually faceted, expansively metamorphosed crystals beneath the melt-freeze crust. At high altitudes, small-sized snowdrifts have been generated over small areas. On shady slopes in high alpine regions, isolated weak layers occur inside the snowpack. Surface hoar also frequently occurs. South-facing slopes are bare of snow up to high altitudes.  Only limited information is currently available to the Avalanche Warning Services from outlying terrain.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger expected to remain low

weatherForecast.comment: It will remain sunny all day long, skies are frequently cloudless, but temperatures will be deep-wintery cold, and winds will sharpen the subjective feeling of cold a further notch. At 2000m: -12 to -7 degrees; at 3000m: -14 degrees. Moderate, frequently brisk northerly winds at high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can in isolated cases be triggered in extremely steep terrain. These releases are mostly small-sized. The risks of falling and sustaining injuries outweigh those of being buried in snow masses.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Not much snow. Low avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: The old snowpack surface is generally melt-freeze encrusted, in most places it is hardened. It then softens up slightly on sunny slopes during the daytime hours. South-facing slopes are bare of snow up to high altitudes, only in sparse places is there snow on the ground. Only limited information is currently available to the Avalanche Warning Services from outlying terrain.

tendency.highlights: No significant change anticipated. Low avalanche danger will continue.

weatherForecast.comment: It will remain sunny all day long, skies are frequently cloudless, but temperatures will be deep-wintery cold, and winds will sharpen the subjective feeling of cold a further notch. At 2000m: -12 to -7 degrees; at 3000m: -14 degrees. Moderate, frequently brisk northerly winds at high altitudes.
